title.narrative: Sustainable Consumption and Production (SCP) of hand-woven textiles (Songket, Ulos, Lurik, Abaca, Ikat): Female Entrepreneurship in Indonesia and the Philippines

description.narrative: Overall objective: To contribute to economic prosperity and poverty reduction in Indonesia and the Philippines through promoting sustainable hand-woven eco-textile value chain development.

description.narrative: Indonesia (West, South and North Sumatra; East and West Kalimantan; East and West Nusa Tenggara; Central Java, South East Sulawesi, Central Sulawesi, Bali); the Philippines (NIR-Negros Island Region, CAR-Cordillera Administrative Region, Region I-Ilocos Region, Region IVA-Calabarzon, Region IVB-Mimaropa, Region VI- Western Visayas, Region IX-Zamboanga Peninsula, Region X-Northern Mindanao, Region XII-Soccskargen)

description.narrative: Reported results indicators by the European Commission ¿ International Cooperation and Development (DEVCO) may not represent the complete set of indicators monitored for the project. The results are reported using a contribution approach. This means that where a project has been financed by the EU jointly with other funders ¿ such as partner country governments or other donors ¿ the overall outputs of the collective effort are reported rather than outputs attributed to the share of funding provided by the EU. For higher levels of results, such as outcomes and impacts, the project will only have contributed to the overall effort.
